explanation: Funds are available from section 8119 of division C of Public Law 117-328, the Department of Defense Appropriations Act, 2023, appropriated to O&M, Defense-Wide and made available for transfer only to other appropriations available to the Department of Defense in Department of Defense Appropriations Acts for the purpose of conducting activities relating to improvements of infrastructure and defueling at the RHBFSF. Funds may also be transferred back to section 8119 of division C of Public Law 117-328, the Department of Defense Appropriations Act, 2023, should it be determined that all or part of the funds transferred from this appropriation are not necessary for the purpose of conducting activities relating to improvements of infrastructure and defueling at the RHBFSF.

Funds are available due to a change in the resourcing strategy. These funds were previously transferred under IR FY23-49 to procure portable drinking water granular activated carbon (GAC) system filtration equipment. Rather than utilizing procurement funds, the filtration requirements have been addressed via contractor support funded through operations and maintenance. These funds can be repurposed to address Red Hill requirements in other appropriations.

Funds are required to support continued environmental remediation operations at RHBFSF through the facility sustainment, restoration, and modernization of Red Hill Water Well Pumps 2 & 4 and continued operation and maintenance of Granular Activated Carbon (GAC) filters to treat water from the Red Hill aquifer.

Funds are required to support the cleaning and closure of four 420,000-gallon surge tanks in the RHBFSF, and for the conduct of an environmental site assessment to identify areas of concern for follow-up investigation and remediation.
